LanguageData.BS_Straight_Tip: Heterosexuality is romantic attraction, sexual attraction or sexual behavior between persons of the opposite sex or gender.
LanguageData.BS_Gay_Tip: Homosexuality is romantic attraction, sexual attraction, or sexual behavior between members of the same sex or gender.
LanguageData.BS_Bisexual_Tip: Bisexuality is romantic attraction, sexual attraction, or sexual behavior toward both males and females, or to more than one gender.
LanguageData.BS_Pansexual_Tip: Pansexuality is sexual, romantic, or emotional attraction towards people regardless of their sex or gender identity.
LanguageData.BS_Asexual_Tip: Asexuality is the lack of sexual attraction to others, or low or absent interest in or desire for sexual activity.
LanguageData.BS_Cisgender_Tip: A cisgender person is a person whose gender identity matches their sex assigned at birth.
LanguageData.BS_Transgender_Tip: Transgender people have a gender identity or gender expression that differs from the sex that they were assigned at birth.
LanguageData.BS_Nonbinary_Tip: Non-binary or genderqueer is an umbrella term for gender identities that are neither male nor female‍—‌identities that are outside the gender binary.
